output.conclusion: By completing this course, you've gained a foundational understanding of the endocrine system. You should now be able to identify the major glands, their hormones, and their functions. This knowledge serves as a stepping stone for further exploration in physiology and related fields.
output.introduction: Welcome to the Introduction to the Endocrine System! This course is designed for beginners and will provide a comprehensive overview of the endocrine system, its glands, hormones, and functions. Each module is designed to be easily digestible and engaging.

chapters.description: Introduction to the endocrine system as a communication network. Comparison with the nervous system. Overview of hormones and their role as chemical messengers.
Defining endocrine glands and hormones. Explanation of hormone secretion and transport. Brief overview of hormone receptors.
Location and function of the hypothalamus. Its role in regulating hormone secretion. Introduction to releasing and inhibiting hormones.

chapters.chapterTitle: The Pituitary Gland: The Master Gland
chapters.description: Anterior and posterior pituitary glands. Hormones secreted by each lobe and their target organs. Brief discussion of pituitary disorders.
Location and structure of the thyroid gland. Production and function of thyroid hormones (T3 and T4). Role in metabolism and energy regulation.
Location and function of the parathyroid glands. Production and function of parathyroid hormone (PTH). Role in calcium homeostasis.
Location and structure of the adrenal glands (cortex and medulla). Hormones secreted by each region (cortisol, aldosterone, epinephrine, norepinephrine).

chapters.chapterTitle: The Role of Cortisol and Aldosterone
chapters.description: Function of cortisol in stress response and metabolism. Function of aldosterone in regulating sodium and potassium balance.
Location and endocrine function of the pancreas. Production and function of insulin and glucagon. Role in regulating blood glucose levels.
Introduction to diabetes mellitus (Type 1 and Type 2). Brief overview of the causes, symptoms, and complications of diabetes.

chapters.chapterTitle: The Reproductive Glands: Ovaries and Testes
chapters.description: Location and function of the ovaries in females. Production and function of estrogen and progesterone. Role in female reproductive development and function.
Location and function of the testes in males. Production and function of testosterone. Role in male reproductive development and function.
